intro: Psychotria refractiflora, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are often surrounded by dense, velvety foliage. It typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Psychotria refractiflora is also noted for its psychoactive properties, containing alkaloids similar to those found in other members of the genus.
